image.altText: A close-up shot of WA Premier Mark McGowan speaking at a media conference indoors in front of a blonde woman.

items.synopsis: WA Premier Mark McGowan abruptly resigns from politics in an unexpected announcement at a press conference, saying the job has left him "extremely tired".

title.children: 'Exhausted' WA Premier Mark McGowan resigns, citing relentless pressure of job

image.altText: Woman with short blonde hair wearing a green sweater standing in front of a lake.

items.synopsis: Australian citizen Daniel Duggan is currently in custody, pending extradition to the US on charges of conspiracy, arms trafficking and money laundering. But the timing of his indictment and arrest has raised questions.

title.children: Australian citizen Daniel Duggan is accused of training Chinese military pilots by the US. His wife alleges he's caught in a 'political power play'

image.altText: teenager and son smiling in cricket gear, nice loving photo

items.synopsis: The father of a 17-year-old who died suddenly during a regional Victorian football game has spoken about Dallas Keogh-Frankling's final moments and wants players to honour him by continuing to participate in the game they love.

title.children: Father of 'shy and polite' teenage footballer who died after tackle tells of son's final moments

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Alexander Lukashenko smile as they shake hands and pose for a photo between two white columns.

items.synopsis: Alexander Lukashenko, Vladimir Putin's staunchest ally, invites other countries to "join in the Union State of Belarus and Russia" a week after the Kremlin deploys nuclear weapons in his country.

title.children: Lukashenko offers 'nuclear weapons for everyone' as Russia targets Kyiv with airstrikes

image.altText: A portrait of Lindsey Graham against the backdrop of the US capitol building.

items.synopsis: Russia's interior ministry has put US senator Lindsey Graham on a wanted list, Russian media reports, citing the ministry's database.

title.children: Russia puts US senator Lindsey Graham on wanted list

image.altText: A group of women wave Aboriginal flags in front of a stone building

items.synopsis: While other states take steps, and even strides, towards reconciliation with their Indigenous communities, what’s happened in Tasmania in the 18 months since a report urged the Tasmanian government legislate a framework towards a treaty?

title.children: Eighteen months after a report urged truth-telling in Tasmania, has anything changed?

image.altText: A ship in the ocean.

items.synopsis: Malaysia's maritime agency says it has found a cannon shell believed to be from World War II on a Chinese-registered barge carrier and is investigating whether the vessel has been involved in looting two British warship wrecks.

title.children: Chinese barge suspected of being involved in looting British WWII wrecks

image.altText: A woman hold a rainbow fan in front of her face.

items.synopsis: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni has signed one of the world's harshest anti-LGBTQ laws, defying condemnations from Western governments, businesses and human rights activists.

title.children: Uganda's president approves anti-LGBTQ laws, including 20-year sentence for 'promoting' homosexuality

image.altText: image of bochara crash scene on May 28 and one of the crash victims joshua elmes

items.synopsis: The sole survivor of a devastating fatal crash in Victoria's west is showing signs of recovery in hospital, as the community mourns the loss of four people who died in the tragedy.

title.children: Mum's heartbreaking message to four 'lost angels' following fatal crash in Victoria

image.altText: A woman wearing a black puffer jacket with long blonde hair and knee-high boots

items.synopsis: Tatiana Dokhotaru's body was found 20 hours after she initially called police on Friday evening, saying she was being assaulted. Her former partner, Danny Zayat, has been charged with several domestic violence offences.

title.children: Sydney man facing domestic violence charges after ex-partner's body found in Liverpool

image.altText: Balin Stewart with his parents Michael and Kerri-Lyn.

items.synopsis: Crown Prosecutor Rebecca Marks tells a Supreme Court jury there had been years of hostility between the two boys which stemmed from their association with a teenage girl.

title.children: Teenager pleads not guilty to stabbing murder of 16-year-old Sunshine Coast boy Balin Stewart

image.altText: A person walks outside PWC.

items.synopsis: Under-fire accounting and consultancy firm PwC directs nine of its partners to take leave pending the outcome of an internal investigation into the leaking of confidential Australian government tax information.

title.children: PwC orders nine partners to go on leave amid tax scandal fallout

image.altText: A digger shifts bricks on a street in front of buildings

items.synopsis: Two homeless people believed to have been sleeping in the historic building remain unaccounted for, as authorities prepare to question a fourth teenage boy in relation to last week's blaze in Surry Hills.

title.children: Bodies could be found in rubble after Sydney building fire, police warn

image.altText: Mark McGowan makes a number one sign during victory speech while standing next to his wife.

items.synopsis: When he drove across the Nullarbor in his Corolla from NSW in 1991, few could have predicted navy lawyer Mark McGowan would go onto become the most popular premier in WA history.

title.children: The life and times of Mark McGowan, the state premier who enjoyed rock star popularity levels

image.altText: A dad and daughter smile for a photo.

items.synopsis: A father is opening up about his daughter's death after she lost her life to anorexia nervosa. He says the illness took hold after a bullying incident.

title.children: Before her death at age 15, Liv pinpointed the moment her life spiralled. Her dad says he was blamed

image.altText: Mauricio Pochettino wearing a puffer jacket.

items.synopsis: The former Tottenham Hotspur and Paris St Germain manager signs a two-year contract with the option of a further year.

title.children: Ex-Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino appointed new manager of Chelsea

image.altText: Aerial photo of Hobart's Tasman Bridge

items.synopsis: Attempts to cut down the number of councils in Tasmania have failed dismally in the past. Now, what a reduced number could look like has been released for public comment.

title.children: 29 councils for just over half a million Tasmanians — public gets say on 'big changes'

image.altText: The needle rests in the middle of the black lines indicating the strength of the quake on a red and white graph

items.synopsis: The Sunbury earthquake was fairly typical of Victorian tremors so why did it cause such a stir?

title.children: Why a minor earthquake woke tens of thousands of people in Melbourne

image.altText: A boat on the Great Barrier Reef off Haggerstone Island

items.synopsis: Wildlife authorities are investigating a crocodile attack off an exclusive island resort in Far North Queensland — the fifth such incident in the region this year.

title.children: 'It got its jaws around my head': Crocodile attack survivor tells of amazing escape

image.altText: A burninig dual cab Toyota Land Cruiser in remote spinifex country near Balgo, Western Australia, 2023.

items.synopsis: Thought snakes and crocodiles were the main hazard in the outback? Think again. Motoring experts say after the big wet season cars are catching alight due to vegetation growth.

title.children: Outback travellers put on notice after increase in car fires

image.altText: Tight crop generic image of unidentified Carlton players standing together

items.synopsis: Carlton board member Craig Mathieson quits after a heated verbal exchange with the club's president in the change rooms after the team's loss to Sydney.

title.children: Carlton director quits after dressing room spat with club president

image.altText: A young woman cuddles a French Bulldog with a big smile on her face

items.synopsis: Since the death of their daughter nearly two years ago, Sophie Putland's family has worked tirelessly to advocate for change in the veterinary industry.

title.children: Sophie Putland's family say she loved being a vet, but the abuse she faced really affected her mental health

image.altText: Brendan Godfrey looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: A man who has pleaded guilty to menacing another man via social media says he and an associate did it because the victim was posting misinformation about COVID-19 online — something which angered him as he was awaiting a kidney transplant.

title.children: Pair created fake social media profiles to 'taunt, mock and ridicule' COVID sceptic, court hears

image.altText: Families locked out of rental market

items.synopsis: A new report from ANZ and CoreLogic shows since the pandemic rental prices have increased dramatically, and low-income earners would need to spend more than half their pay to secure a rental property.

title.children: Haya shares a room with her partner and two children. She is facing extreme rental stress

image.altText: A man sits in a garden and looks to the side of the camera.

items.synopsis: Reforms in the wake of the child sexual abuse royal commission made it easier for victims to seek compensation, but now a fierce new battleground is emerging as some organisations at the centre of the claims push to have cases thrown out altogether.

title.children: The church knew Josh's abuser was a danger to kids. When Josh sued, they went after his family

image.altText: A man wearing a suit poses for a photo

items.synopsis: The race discrimination commissioner warns against making race the focus of debate on the Voice to Parliament, as opponents claim it will "re-racialise" the nation.

title.children: Voice opponents reassert body will 're-racialise' Australia, after warning from discrimination commissioner

image.altText: A smiling young man who is clean shaven

items.synopsis: Sydney man Mohammad Hashemi's cousin Majid Kazemi was executed after a "forced confession and sham trial". He says if the Australian government is serious about stopping the Islamic Republic's human rights abuses, it will cut ties with Iran and list their military arm as a terrorist organisation.

title.children: 'I swear to God I am innocent': Majid Kazemi begged for Australia's help before Iran's government executed him

image.altText: A screenshot of David Koch on Sunrise, with a banner announcing he's leaving the show

items.synopsis: Known by fans of the show as "Kochie", the veteran television presenter says it's time to bring in the "next generation" and is looking forward to working within business hours.

title.children: David Koch quits Sunrise hosting gig after two decades

image.altText: A man its in the driver's seat of a car smiling at a camera

items.synopsis: The adoption of electric vehicles continues to climb as sales in most states and territories double year-on-year. These people explain why they are, or are not, following the trend.

title.children: EVs sales still lag behind combustion engine cars. What are people debating?

image.altText: A photo of the crowd at the Kununurra rodeo.

items.synopsis: Two people are injured after a bull escaped from an enclosure at Kununurra Rodeo on Saturday night, terrifying spectators.

title.children: Child taken to hospital after bull charges through line dancing crowd at rodeo

image.altText: A young white woman with short brown hair and glasses. She's wearing a maroon jumper and holding a rubix cube

items.synopsis: Autism diagnoses are rising, but researchers say autistic girls and women are going under the radar, because diagnostic tools have been designed around how it manifests in males.

title.children: Heather was nearly 40 when diagnosed as autistic. She says the delay forced her into 'unhealthy' habits
